title.narrative: Africa - capacity building and training activities

description.narrative: Niche training, capacity building and research activities promoting key objectives of the Aid Investment Plan, including aid for trade, governance and peace and security. Some of the activities include: a course on Border security (in line with objectives 1 and 3 in Aid Investment Plan) and in recognition that weak border security can be a major facilitator of terrorism and that groups like Boko Haram and al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb (AQIM) have led to massive regional displacements); supporting a research institution focussed on political developments, including radicalism, in East, Central and West Africa, as well as Zimbabwe; and delivering a trade course targeting capacity building and human resource development for the private sector, in particular Small and Medium Enterprise operators in Mauritius, Madagascar, the Seychelles, Mozambique and possibly Comoros. The training program will help to build the capacity of business and chambers of commerce in the region to understand an
